channel.title: Max level : 120
channel.description:
I lagged about 2 minutes ago on my botter as I was shutting it off I clicked on my stats to see how many levels I gained and it froze and all skills were 120. Everyone of them. Thought in my mind fuck yea epic bot is epic but my true stats came out.
Has this happened to anyone else?
I also notice when I log in sometimes when my character loads it will the load another part of the map where I never explored but quickly switches to my log out position. Each loading location is different. Think this may have something to do with idk?

item.title: Max level : 120
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:12, topic:382236”][quote author=IlikeArrays link=topic=478039.msg3498614#msg3498614 date=1297549517]
So is it possible to manipulate this? Maybe when its in the middle of loading a 3rd party client will cut off the loading so that it will be 1337 forever?

Or how about a client just creating packets that are sent to the server (real packets) so that you can sit in lumbridge once you log in and get exp for whatever skill you want? So when you click on an object its sent to the server which outputs whether you succeeded or not and gives you exp accordingly. Maybe it would be possible to trick the server into actually believing a person is clicking on a tree when they are not?
[/quote]RuneScape is not programmed by Delta_.[/quote]
WHAT?!??! YES IT IS! :coolface:

But this is old guys… ive seen this happen alot… there are videos on it too… this isnt something secret lol.

nightmareRH has a video on it too

Read full topic

item.title: Max level : 120
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:22, topic:382236”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=478039.msg3499032#msg3499032 date=1297585955]

[quote author=IlikeArrays link=topic=478039.msg3499025#msg3499025 date=1297584820]

if you sent a false packet to the runescape server (item on player, christmas cracker on player b for example), the server would see that you don’t have a cracker in your inventory and ban you.

What if you just sent a false packet that represents that you are attempting to mine an object that is not there?
[/quote]The server reads the packet data sent, then checks to see if it’s real or not.

Yea I understand that part but there should be some loop holes.
[/quote]If there were, people would have abused them years ago.

Which they have done numerous times in the past. Need to find a new one :D[/quote]

Maybe with that screen @ the end of dungeoneering

Read full topic

item.title: Max level : 120
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:16, topic:382236”][quote author=`Alec link=topic=478039.msg3498784#msg3498784 date=1297562571]

So is it possible to manipulate this? Maybe when its in the middle of loading a 3rd party client will cut off the loading so that it will be 1337 forever?

Or how about a client just creating packets that are sent to the server (real packets) so that you can sit in lumbridge once you log in and get exp for whatever skill you want? So when you click on an object its sent to the server which outputs whether you succeeded or not and gives you exp accordingly. Maybe it would be possible to trick the server into actually believing a person is clicking on a tree when they are not?
[/quote]No, just no…

So if you sent a false packet to the client, what happens?

to the client?? if you send a false packet to the server (hur dur) you get banned (more hur dur, they obviously check…) or you’d see people with 234324325442353 partyhats…

I don’t code, so what would actually happen?

if you sent a false packet to the runescape server (item on player, christmas cracker on player b for example), the server would see that you don’t have a cracker in your inventory and ban you.

What if u try to fck with it in trade screen, like make it so they accept[/quote]
If you make so another person has to accept, then it would check if that packet actually came from them first… how are you going to make them send packets to Runescape’s server?

Read full topic

item.title: Max level : 120
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

So is it possible to manipulate this? Maybe when its in the middle of loading a 3rd party client will cut off the loading so that it will be 1337 forever?

Or how about a client just creating packets that are sent to the server (real packets) so that you can sit in lumbridge once you log in and get exp for whatever skill you want? So when you click on an object its sent to the server which outputs whether you succeeded or not and gives you exp accordingly. Maybe it would be possible to trick the server into actually believing a person is clicking on a tree when they are not?

Read full topic
